message:
Fact 25 ~ For Medical Professionals
A U.S. study on sex trafficking found that more than 85 percent of survivors had contact with a health care professional while being trafficked. 

Spotting Signs of Sex Trafficking for Health Care Providers- Red flags in a patient’s presentation and health care history that warrant further questions: poor eye contact; anxiety; a scripted or mechanically recited history; being a runaway or in the foster-care system; sexual promiscuity; recurrent STIs; multiple pregnancies; malnourishment; substance addiction; weather-inappropriate clothing; bruising, scars, or burns in hidden places; a tattoo of a pimp’s name or a strange symbol; the inability to provide an address; and a companion who refuses to leave the examination room.

30 Facts ~ Human Trafficking Prevention and Awareness. 

#HealthCare #EducateYourself #ProtectOurKids

data.title: 30 Facts about Human Trafficking
